what: Test whether a string is a valid UKFSR indicator id — check_indicator
title: Test whether a string is a valid UKFSR indicator id — check_indicator
text: UKFSR indicator can uniquely identified 3 main hierarchical components separated periods: theme (1-5) see Food Security Index section (1-9) indicator (1-99) optional variant suffix form (-z). Thus valid indicator id string form "T.S.Iv". examples "1.3.7a". "4.2.11". check_indicator tests indicator id string compliance returns TRUE FALSE. Food Security Index FSI also contains set indicators. FSI2024 used UKFSR infrastructure generate graphics. result exceptional set indicator ids possible, theme can 'fsi'.

title: Test whether a string is a valid UKFSR indicator id — check_indicator
Test whether a string is a valid UKFSR indicator id — check_indicator
text: string String containing UKFSR indicator id

title: Test whether a string is a valid UKFSR indicator id — check_indicator
text: logical

title: Test whether a string is a valid UKFSR indicator id — check_indicator
code: # A valid id check_indicator("2.3.5a") #> [1] TRUE  # An invalid id check_indicator("10.3.1") #> [1] FALSE

title: Parse a UKFSR indicator id into its components — parse_indicator
code: i <- parse_indicator("3.2.1b") i$theme #> [1] "3" i$section #> [1] "2" i$indicator #> [1] "1" i$variant #> [1] "b"

Save a UKFSR graphic to the S3 bucket — save_graphic
text: graphic ggplot chart object indicator_id valid UKFSR indicator id. See check_indicator(). indicator_desc title graphic

title: Save a UKFSR graphic to the S3 bucket — save_graphic
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ chart <- ggplot2::ggplot(mtcars) +  ggplot2::geom_point(ggplot2::aes(x = mpg, y = wt))  save_graphic(chart, "1.1.1", "Test graphic") #file created will be '1_1_1_test_graphic.png/svg' } # }

title: UKFSR chart theme — theme_ukfsr
text: UKFSR chart theme

title: UKFSR chart theme — theme_ukfsr
code: theme_ukfsr(   base_size = 14,   base_family = "",   base_line_size = base_size/20,   base_rect_size = base_size/20,   horizontal = FALSE,   chart_line_size = 2 )

title: UKFSR chart theme — theme_ukfsr
text: base_size Base font size pts base_family Base font family base_line_size Base size line elements base_rect_size Base size rect elements horizontal Set TRUE adjust theme horizontal plots chart_line_size sets default line width geom_line. See Default theme settings

title: UKFSR chart theme — theme_ukfsr
text: chart theme

title: UKFSR chart theme — theme_ukfsr
text: Used default parameters, theme_ukfsr() formats charts following way: base_size defines default text size 14pt. chart text elements assigned font sizes relative using multiplier, . axis.text: 1.8 axis.title: 1.8 legend.text: 2 strip.text: 2.2 (facet titles) plot.title 1.2 plot.caption 0.8 default linewidth lines rectangles 0.7. Chart line width theme_ukfsr() uses ggplot2::update_geom_defaults() change default line width used ggplot2::geom_line(). sure strictly speaking good practice theme affect geom. impact uses geom_line theme_ukfsr() applied. can override individual charts lwd parameter.

title: UKFSR chart theme — theme_ukfsr
code: ggplot2::ggplot(mtcars) +  ggplot2::geom_point(ggplot2::aes(x = mpg, y = wt)) +  theme_ukfsr()
